thread.title: Here's the answer sheet for USA TODAY Sports' Super Bowl pool sheet
thread.title_full: Here's the answer sheet for USA TODAY Sports' Super Bowl pool sheet

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Here's the answer sheet for USA TODAY Sports' Super Bowl pool sheet
text:
Here's the answer sheet for USA TODAY Sports' Super Bowl pool sheet Mike Ricigliano offers the answer key to USA TODAY’s Super Bowl pool. Circled answers are correct. Cross-outs are pushes, with no correct answer. Post to Facebook Here's the answer sheet for USA TODAY Sports' Super Bowl pool sheet Mike Ricigliano offers the answer key to USA TODAY’s Super Bowl pool. Circled answers are correct. Cross-outs are pushes, with no correct answer.  //usat.ly/2kdXaqe   Here's the answer sheet for USA TODAY Sports' Super Bowl pool sheet Erik Brady , USA TODAY Sports 11:23   Answer key for Super Bowl pool sheet from USA TODAY Sports. (Photo: Cartoon by Mike Ricigliano for USA TODAY Sports) 
Mike Ricigliano offers the answer key to USA TODAY’s Super Bowl pool. Circled answers are correct. Cross-outs are pushes, with no correct answer. 
Ricig is the cartoonist (and thus the commissioner) of the pool (he’s been running versions of this for his family and friends for more than 25 years) so we give him the last word on close calls. Your results may vary. Hope you won! 
MORE SUPER BOWL COVERAGE: PHOTOS: Best of Super Bowl LI Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Tom Brady hoists the Lombardi Trophy after the Patriots beat the Falcons to win Super Bowl LI. Brady and New England won 34-28 in the first-ever Super Bowl to go to overtime. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   hoists the Lombardi Trophy for the fifth time, most of any quarterback ever. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Winning the Super Bowl appears to be one of the rare things that can get Patriots head coach Bill Belichick to crack a smile. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Patriots owner Robert Kraft hoists the Lombardi Trophy. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots quarterback celebrates with coach Bill Belichick after winning their fifth Super Bowl title together. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell greets Patriots coach Bill Belichick after the game. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots linebacker Dont'a Hightower (54) celebrates with defensive coordinator Matt Patricia. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman celebrates. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Patriots offensive tackle Marcus Cannon celebrates with the Lombardi Trophy. Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports Patriots coach Bill Belichick, right, celebrates with receiver Danny Amendola. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Tom Brady couldn't believe it either after becoming the first quarterback to win five Super Bowl titles. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Tom Brady shares a moment with Bill Belichick on the podium after winning the Super Bowl. Kirby Lee, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back LeGarrette Blount celebrates. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots linebacker Kyle Van Noy celebrates. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Patriots coach Bill Belichick celebrates with linebacker Elandon Roberts. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) shakes hands with and his Falcons counterpart Matt Ryan (2) after the game. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports A despondent Matt Ryan leaves the field after the Falcons lost Super Bowl LI. Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Julio Jones leaves the field in disappointment. Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Tom Brady (12), Julian Edelman (11) and the Patriots celebrate. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White (28) fights his way into the end zone to score the game-winning touchdown in overtime. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White (28) stretches acorss the goal line to score the game-winning touchdown in overtime. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) celebrates after James White scored the game-winning touchdown in overtime. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Danny Amendola (80) fights his way into the end zone to score the game-tying two-point conversion late in the fourth quarter. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White (28) plunges into the end zone to score late in the fourth-quarter. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White celebrates his fourth-quarter touchdown run that helped tie the score. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White celebrates his fourth-quarter touchdown. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Julio Jones (11) makes an out-stretched catch over Patriots cornerback Eric Rowe (25) during the fourth quarter. Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Julio Jones (11) hauls in an incredible catch along the sideline behind Patriots cornerback Eric Rowe (25) during the fourth quarter. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Julio Jones (11) just gets both feet down for a fourth-quarter catch against Patriots cornerback Eric Rowe (25). Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Mohamed Sanu (12) tries to stiff-arm his way past Patriots cornerback Logan Ryan (26) during the fourth quarter. Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) dives to make a crucial fourth-quarter catch against Falcons safety Keanu Neal (22). Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) cradles the ball just before it hits the turf for a fourth-quarter catch against Falcons defenders Keanu Neal (22) and Ricardo Allen (37). Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   celebrates a successful two-point conversion during the fourth quarter. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Danny Amendola (80) hauls in a fourth-quarter touchdown catch. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Patriots linebacker Dont'a Hightower (54) forces a fumble by Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan (2) during the fourth quarter. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Devonta Freeman (24) races by Patriots linebacker Elandon Roberts (52) on a fourth-quarter carry. Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Falcons defensive tackle Grady Jarrett (97) drops Patriots   (12) for a fourth-quarter sack. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Falcons defensive tackle Grady Jarrett (97) celebrates his fourth-quarter sack with Jonathan Babineaux (95). Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) picks himself up after a fourth-quarter sack as the Falcons celebrate behind him. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Falcons defensive tackle Grady Jarrett (97) sacks Patriots   (12) during the fourth quarter. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Patriots tight end Martellus Bennett (88) hauls in a fourth-quarter catch behind Falcons safety Keanu Neal (22). Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   leaves the field after a fourth-quarter drive stalled. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Jalen Collins (32) tackles Patriots receiver Malcolm Mitchell (19) after a fourth-quarter catch. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Falcons defensive tackle Grady Jarrett (97) takes down Patriots   (12) for a sack during the fourth quarter. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Tevin Coleman (26) celebrates his third-quarter touchdown with Matt Ryan (2) and Justin Hardy (16). Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Tevin Coleman (26) scampers past Patriots linebacker Rob Ninkovich (50) into the end zone for a touchdown during the third quarter. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White (28) stretches across the goal line to score between a trio of Falcons defenders during the third quarter. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan (2) commands the huddle during the third quarter. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) pulls it down and runs for a first down during the third quarter. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) passes on a third-quarter trick play. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White (28) runs past Falcons defender Keanu Neal on a third-quarter carry. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Tevin Coleman (26) finds a hole in the line on a third-quarter rush. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots  , left, confers with offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, center and head coach Bill Belichick during the third quarter. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan (2) directs the offense during the third quarter. Kirby Lee, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Jalen Collins (32) breaks up a third-quarter pass intended for Patriots receiver Chris Hogan (15). Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan (2) eludes Patriots defensive end Trey Flowers (98) on a third-quarter throw. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons safety Keanu Neal (22) brings down Patriots running back Dion Lewis (33) during the third quarter. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Robert Alford (23) takes his second-quarter interception all the back for a touchdown. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   tries to pick himself up off the turf after throwing a pick-six during the second quarter. Kirby Lee, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Robert Alford (23) leaves Patriots   (12) in his dust on an interception return for a touchdown during the second quarter. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Robert Alford (23) eludes Patriots   (12) on his way to returning an interception for a touchdown during the second quarter. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Robert Alford (23) celebrates his second-quarter touchdown with Devonta Freeman (24) and Eric Weems (14). Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) picks himself off the turf after throwing a pick-six during the second quarter. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Falcons linebacker Vic Beasley (44) pressures Patriots   (12) during the second quarter. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons safety Keanu Neal (22) knocks Patriots running back James White (28) out of bounds on a second-quarter carry. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Brian Poole (34) exchanges heated words with Patriots receiver Danny Amendola (80) during the second quarter. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Patriots safety Patrick Chung (23) breaks up a pass intended for Falcons tight end Austin Hooper (81) at the goal line during the second quarter. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots tight end Martellus Bennett (88) eludes would-be Falcons tackler Jalen Collins (32) after a second-quarter catch. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) directs the offense during the second quarter. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Falcons tight end Austin Hooper (81) celebrates his second-quarter touchdown catch with guard Andy Levitre (67). Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Falcons tight end Austin Hooper (81) beats Patriots safety Patrick Chung (23) to bring in a second-quarter touchdown catch. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman can't come up with a second-quarter pass. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots coach Bill Belichick expresses his displeasure with a call during the second quarter. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Julio Jones (11) gets both feet in for a second-quarter catch in front of Patriots cornerback Eric Rowe (25). Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Devonta Freeman dives across the goal line to score during the second quarter. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Devonta Freeman dives into the end zone for a second-quarter touchdown. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Devonta Freeman celebrates his second-quarter touchdown run. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Robert Alford (23) pounces on a fumble ahead of Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) during the second quarter. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Julio Jones (11) hauls in a second-quarter catch in front of Patriots defenders Duron Harmon (30) and Logan Ryan (26). Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots running back James White (28) hauls in a first-quarter catch against Falcons defender Deion Jones (45). Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Robert Alford (23) tackles Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) after a first-quarter catch. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Falcons cornerback Jalen Collins (32) takes down Patriots receiver Chris Hogan (15) during the first quarter. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Falcons defensive end Courtney Upshaw (91) takes down Patriots   (12) for a first-quarter sack. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Falcons defensive end Courtney Upshaw celebrates a first-quarter sack. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) gets upended by Falcons linebacker Philip Wheeler (41) after a first-quarter catch. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) looks to pass over Falcons linebacker Vic Beasley (44) during the first quarter. Mark J. Rebilas, USA TODAY Sports Patriots defensive end Trey Flowers (98) brings down Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan (2) for a first-quarter sack. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Devonta Freeman (24) eludes Patriots linebacker Rob Ninkovich (50) on a first-quarter rush. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Patriots receiver Julian Edelman (11) gets upended by Falcons linebacker Philip Wheeler (41) after a first-quarter catch. Troy Taormina, USA TODAY Sports Patriots wide receiver Malcolm Mitchell (19) hauls in a first-quarter catch. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   (12) just gets rid of the ball under pressure from Falcons defensive tackle Ra'Shede Hageman (77) during the first quarter. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports A trio of Patriots defenders brings down Falcons running back Devonta Freeman (24) on a first-quarter carry. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   gets fired up ahead of kickoff. Kirby Lee, USA TODAY Sports Falcons receiver Eric Weems gives a young fan a souvenir football during warm-ups. Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Falcons quarterback and newly-minted league MVP Matt Ryan warms up prior to kickoff. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Patriots   gets a hug from former teammate Randy Moss before the game. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports The Patriots mascot prepares for the big game. Eric Seals, USA TODAY Sports Linebacker LaRoy Reynolds, center, gathers a group of Falcons together prior to kickoff. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons owner Arthur Blank, right, greets Patriots owner Robert Kraft on the field before the game. Richard Mackson, USA TODAY Sports Falcons coach Dan Quinn talks with linebacker Deion Jones (45) ahead of kickoff. Daniel Powers, USA TODAY Sports Falcons running back Devonta Freeman stretches before kickoff. Matthew Emmons, USA TODAY Sports Patriots safety Devin McCourty, center, speaks with his defensive backfield teammates before kickoff. Bob Donnan, USA TODAY Sports Like this topic?
